newsitem.title: CANADA: Southam shareholders reject Hollinger bid.
newsitem.headline: Southam shareholders reject Hollinger bid.

text.p: Minority shareholders of Southam Inc have rejected a revised C$923 million bid by Canadian press baron Conrad Black's Hollinger Inc to buy the rest of Southam, the Canadian Press reported.
Enough Southam minority shareholders voted against the offer, at a special meeting of shareholders held after market close on Monday, to hold Hollinger to its current 50.45 percent ownership.
Under the terms of the offer, the bid would fail if it was rejected by at least 33.33 percent of minority shareholders.
The bid, revised from an earlier bid by Hollinger, was valued between C$23.55 and C$23.95 a share.
An independent Southam board had recommended shareholders approve the offer.

Toronto-based Southam is Canada's largest newspaper chain by circulation, publishing 58 free and paid circulation newspapers and 32 dailies, including the Montreal Gazette, the Ottawa Citizen and Vancouver Sun.
